style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="font-weight:400;font-family:"Arial"">First we need to change the default storage engine to innodb and change the default file format to Barracuda, this is a new setting compared to previous You also need to set innodb_file_per_table in order for Barracuda to work properly. Ref:</span><span style="font-weight:400;font-family:"Arial""><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/innodb-compression-usage.html&sa=D&ust=1611126796055000&usg=AOvVaw34i_wsYY86ztMaTZga2P16" style="color:inherit;text-decoration:inherit"> </a></span><span style="-webkit-text-decoration-skip:none;color:#1155cc;font-weight:400;text-decoration:underline;text-decoration-skip-ink:none;font-family:"Arial""><a href="https://www.google.com/url?q=https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/innodb-compression-usage.html&sa=D&ust=1611126796055000&usg=AOvVaw34i_wsYY86ztMaTZga2P16" style="color:inherit;text-decoration:inherit">https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.7/en/innodb-compression-usage.html</a></span></p><ul class="lst-kix_lvslay97997r-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding-top:12pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">You should not need to make innodb the default storage engine anymore, the latest version of Moodle will select it automatically during install. It is always a good idea to make it default anyway. You do however need to set the default file format!</span></li></ul><ul class="lst-kix_khwa6io51g75-0 start" style="padding:0;margin:0"><li style="padding-top:12pt;color:#000000;padding-left:0pt;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;line-height:1.0;margin-right:0;margin-left:36pt;font-family:"Calibri";margin-top:0;orphans:2;margin-bottom:0;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span text.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:0pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span deprecated in MariaDB 10.2 and removed in MariaDB.</span></p><p style="padding-top:12pt;margin:0;color:#000000;padding-left:0;font-size:10pt;padding-bottom:12pt;font-family:"Calibri";line-height:1.0;orphans:2;widows:2;text-align:left;padding-right:0"><span style="color:#000000;font-weight:400;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;font-size:10pt;font-family:"Arial";font-style:normal">In order to save my.cnf using the editor, press the Esc (Escape)
